path_utils¶

Functions¶

def iterDirectories()

def iterFiles()

def openFile()

Description¶

General purpose utility functions relating to paths.

msTools.core.py.path_utils.iterDirectories(root, walk=False, paths=True)¶

Yield the names or paths of directories within the descendant hierarchy of a directory tree.

Parameters:
  • root (basestring) – Absolute path specifying the root of a directory tree from which to traverse.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to walk the entire descendant hierarchy of the directory tree. Defaults to False.
  • paths (bool, optional) – If True, yield the path to each directory, otherwise yield the name of each directory. Defaults to True.
Yields:

str – A path or name for each directory within the traversed directory tree of root.
msTools.core.py.path_utils.iterFiles(root, ext=None, walk=False, paths=True)¶

Yield the names or paths of files within the descendant hierarchy of a directory tree.

Parameters:
  • root (basestring) – Absolute path specifying the root of a directory tree from which to traverse.
  • ext (basestring, optional) – Specify a specific file extension used to filter results. Defaults to None - yield all file extension types.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to walk the entire descendant hierarchy of the directory tree. Defaults to False.
  • paths (bool, optional) – If True, yield the path to each file, otherwise yield the name of each file. Defaults to True.
Yields:

str – A path or name for each file within the traversed directory tree of root.
msTools.core.py.path_utils.openFile(path)¶

Opens a file or folder at the given path.
